CatDescriptText: Esther Green, fraternal leader, 2823 Wylie Avenue and Leon Gray, singer, Webster Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 11, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that all bingo games, including those for the benefit of churches, veteran's groups, or hospitals, should be outlawed?" Mrs. Green's answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  After all, people should be allowed to have recreation."  Mr. Gray's answer reads: "No, I don't, because most games are held for good purposes like benefits for churches and other organizations."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Esther Green wearing patterned dress and jacket, standing in front of store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Leon Gray wearing cabled polo shirt and hat, standing in front of store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown
